chunks.text: If there's a significant age difference, if one of the parties is under 16, they are not able to give consent.
For example, if a 19-year-old female had sex with a 13-year-old male, the 13-year-old is not able to legally give consent.
And it doesn't matter whether the parties are male or female, which way around it is, the younger person under 16 is not legally able to give consent.

text: If there's a significant age difference, if one of the parties is under 16, they are not able to give consent. For example, if a 19-year-old female had sex with a 13-year-old male, the 13-year-old is not able to legally give consent. And it doesn't matter whether the parties are male or female, which way around it is, the younger person under 16 is not legally able to give consent.
